skill.name: ancplua-docs
skill.description: Search and answer questions about the ANcpLua ecosystem documentation. Use when users ask about ANcpLua.NET.Sdk features, ANcpLua.Analyzers rules, ANcpLua.Roslyn.Utilities APIs, or any configuration/usage questions about these packages.
skill.summary: Search and answer questions about the ANcpLua ecosystem documentation. Use when users ask about ANcp...
skill.author: ANcpLua

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation lookup skill with no code execution. It restricts the AI to Read, Grep, and Glob tools only for searching local documentation files. The static findings (external_commands, C2 keywords, weak crypto) are all false positives - bash examples in markdown are documentation, not code; C2 detection was a hex hash substring; SHA256 hashes are secure. No network access, no command execution, no file writing.

content.value_statement: Users need quick answers about ANcpLua .NET SDK, analyzers, and Roslyn utilities. This skill provides structured search strategies and file locations for finding documentation across three repositories.
actual_capabilities: Search documentation across ANcpLua.NET.Sdk, Analyzers, and Utilities repositories
Find analyzer rules AL0001-AL0017 documentation and code fixes
Locate SDK features like banned APIs, polyfills, and MSBuild properties
Answer questions about DiagnosticFlow, SemanticGuard, and SymbolPattern APIs
limitations: Only accesses local documentation files, not online resources
Cannot execute code or run analyzer tests
Does not provide configuration for new projects
Limited to the three ANcpLua repositories

use_cases.title: Find analyzer rule details
use_cases.description: Look up Roslyn analyzer rules AL0001-AL0017 and their code fixes

use_cases.title: Discover SDK features
use_cases.description: Search for banned APIs, polyfills, and MSBuild property documentation

use_cases.title: Explore utilities API
use_cases.description: Find information about DiagnosticFlow, guards, and pattern matching utilities

prompt_templates.title: List analyzer rules
prompt_templates.prompt: What analyzer rules are available in ANcpLua.Analyzers?

prompt_templates.title: Find banned APIs
prompt_templates.prompt: Which APIs are banned in ANcpLua.NET.Sdk?

prompt_templates.title: Use DiagnosticFlow
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use DiagnosticFlow from ANcpLua.Roslyn.Utilities?

prompt_templates.title: Configure tests
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I configure test projects with the ANcpLua SDK?

output_examples.input: What analyzer rules are available in ANcpLua.Analyzers?
output: AL0001 - Prohibit reassignment of primary constructor params
AL0003 - Don't divide by constant zero
See docs/rules/index.md for complete rules table with descriptions

output_examples.input: Which APIs are banned in the SDK?
output: Banned APIs are listed in CLAUDE.md and README.md
Common bans include obsolete methods and unsafe constructs
DiagnosticFlow is a railway-oriented API for result handling
Supports monadic chaining with Bind and Map operations

best_practices: Start with the quick reference files: README.md and CLAUDE.md in each repository
Use the Grep patterns provided for targeted searches
Check doc-locations.md for the complete file map before searching
anti_patterns: Asking the skill to modify source code or configuration files
Expecting the skill to execute analyzer rules or run tests
Asking for documentation outside the ANcpLua ecosystem

faq.question: Does this skill work offline?
faq.answer: Yes. It only reads local documentation files from your ANcpLua repositories.

faq.question: What repositories does this skill cover?
Can the skill execute code?
faq.answer: No. The skill is restricted to Read, Grep, and Glob tools only.

faq.question: Where are the repositories located?
faq.answer: Paths are configured in the skill. Default paths reference local developer directories.

faq.question: How do I update documentation?
faq.answer: The skill cannot modify files. Edit documentation directly in the repositories.

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: Read, Grep, and Glob. No external commands or network calls.
